author: fradamt
content: Do we have a way to test how things work *without* getBlobs? Looking at the blobpool thread (https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/1356361879630643403), it would be good to have a clear idea of how far things can be pushed by relying purely on GossipSub, versus with getBlobs as well

author: cskiraly
content:
depends on what you mean by "test". My simulations were always without getblobs. In that case you really need the publisher to have the bandwith and/or to do the right scheduling. If you have that, think should be quite smooth.
Getblobs adds a few extra diffusion paths (data is popping up in various parts of the network as if you would have several soures or a pre-distribution), but that's not fundamentally different from a good first diffusion step.

 In a testnet I think we should be able to turn it off, and it would be good idea to run that test. If not all clients have such an option, maybe just do the net with the ones that have it.

author: cskiraly
content:
In other words, from the getblobs is equivalent to having a strong first seeding step. There is no fundamental differece. The differences in the details are:
- with getblobs the first diffusion step is much longer in time
- with getblobs it is done over another protocol

author: mininny
content: I think this is something we can look at in another test as well! We could somehow disable blob gossiping in EL, and see how the network uses gossipsub to get blobs.

author: cskiraly
content:
Btw, that's the actual case that will happen with private blob feeds. 

Our prevouls asumption was that who has a private feed also has the capacity to push the data, but they can also pre-distribute the data similar to the public mempool, if they want to do it.
